intro: Boechera arcuata, commonly known as the bentleaf rockcress, is a flowering plant native to the western United States and parts of Canada. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes mustard and cabbage plants. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly habitats, often in mountainous regions. Its leaves are characterized by their wavy, undulating edges, which give it its common name. Boechera arcuata produces small, white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in early spring.
